title.narrative: SOCIAL PROTECTION AND RESILIENCE

description.narrative: By 2020, families, local authorities and the social protection system (including governmental and non-governmental actors) have increased capacity to support vulnerable children in accessing the means to fulfil their rights., which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Economic And Social Policy General, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid), Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the education, child and social protection and health systems, NGOs, communities and families provide vulnerable children with increasingly inclusive opportunities to realize their rights to protection, education, development and participationBy 2020, the education, child and social protection and health systems, NGOs, communities and families provide vulnerable children with increasingly inclusive opportunities to realize their rights to protection, education, development and participation.

Shock responsive social protection - Strengthening social protection system for humanitarian response (preparedness)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, families, local authorities and the social protection system (including governmental and non-governmental actors) haveincreased capacity to support vulnerable children in accessing the means to fulfil their rights.

description.narrative: Despite interruptions in face-to-face learning due to COVID-19, the CCTE Programme continued cash payments to support vulnerable refugee families in accessing education without interruption. UNICEF continued improving the capacities of public, NGO and private stakeholders in meeting the social protection, education and social service referral needs of vulnerable Turkish and refugee children. Through its partnership with the Union of Municipalities, UNICEF continued its efforts to increase municipal capacities in addressing child rights and wellbeing.;;;; | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/01/2021
